# AXBrailleMap

**Class**

A representation of a two-dimensional braille display.

## Declaration

```swift
class AXBrailleMap
```

## Overview

A braille map object represents a two-dimensional braille display that’s connected to the current Apple device. By specifying the dot patterns in the braille map, you can change the content the user experiences. To render the data from the braille map to the display, implement [doc://com.apple.Accessibility/documentation/Accessibility/AXBrailleMapRenderer].

## Creating a braille map

- **init(coder:)**

## Getting display dimensions

- **dimensions**: The number of pins in each dimension of the braille display.

## Accessing dots

- **setHeight(_:at:)**: Sets the height of an individual pin on the braille display.
- **height(at:)**: Retrieves the height of an individual pin on the braille display.
- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses the height of an individual pin on the braille display.

## Displaying images

- **present(_:)**: Converts the data from the image you specify into the braille map.

## Braille maps

- **AXBrailleMapRenderer**: The interface for providing data for a braille map.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
